intro: Sabia lanceolata var. siamensis, commonly known as the Siam sabia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
